en: My spirit is consumed, my days are extinct, The grave is ready for me.
hmr: “Ka thlarau chu a kawidar a, ka nihai chu a hung bo tah a, thlân chu keia ta dingin inzosa a nih.

en: Surely there are mockers with me, And mine eye dwelleth upon their provocation.
hmr: Matheiloin, ka kuoma hin nuisantuhai an um a nih, An suklungsennaa chun ka mit chu a châm zing a nih.

en: Give now a pledge, be surety for me with thyself; Who is there that will strike hands with me?
hmr: “Tuhin intiemna siem la, nangma chu ring tlat ngamna che mi siempêk rawh. Chutaka chun tu am kuthai mi benpui ding an um a?

en: For thou hast hid their heart from understanding: Therefore shalt thou not exalt them.
hmr: An lungril chu nangin hrietnaa inthawkin i thuppêk sih a, Chuleiin, nangin anni chu chawimawi naw ti nih.

en: He that denounceth his friends for a prey, Even the eyes of his children shall fail.
hmr: Fâk dinga a ruolhai inthlim chu, A nauhai mithai ngei khawm chu la hlawsam a tih.

en: But he hath made me a byword of the people; And they spit in my face.
hmr: Ama chun mihai hrilinsîmah a mi siem a; Mî chil sâk khum ka hung ni ta hi.

en: Mine eye also is dim by reason of sorrow, And all my members are as a shadow.
hmr: Lungngaina leiin ka mit khawm a hung inthim a; Ka taksaa bunghai po po khawm chu hlim ang an nih.

en: Upright men shall be astonished at this, And the innocent shall stir up himself against the godless.
hmr: Mi tluong chu hitaka hin mak tîng a ta, Mi pawitâwklo chu Pathien ngaisak lo chungah insukthatho a tih.

en: Yet shall the righteous hold on his way, And he that hath clean hands shall wax stronger and stronger.
hmr: Mi fel chun a lampui chu chel zing a ta, Kut faihai neitu chu hung hrât deu deu a tih.

en: But as for you all, come on now again; And I shall not find a wise man among you.
hmr: Amiruokchu, in rêngin kîr unla, tuhin hung ro: Nangni lai mi var ka hmu thei si nawh a,

en: My days are past, my purposes are broken off, Even the thoughts of my heart.
hmr: Ka nihai chu a liem a, ka thiltumhai chu a hung seh a, Ka lungril ngaituohai ngei chu.

en: They change the night into day: The light, say they, is near unto the darkness.
hmr: Zân chu sûnah an inchangtir a: ‘Var chun inthim a hnai tah,’ an tih a.

en: If I look for Sheol as my house; If I have spread my couch in the darkness;
hmr: Seol chu ka in anga ka en chun, Inthima chun ka ṭhunghmun chu ka rem chun;

en: If I have said to corruption, Thou art my father; To the worm, Thou art my mother, and my sister;
hmr: Khur kuoma chun, ‘Ka pa i nih’ ka tih a, Nge kuoma chun, ‘Ka nu le ka farnu i nih’ ka ti bawk chun,

en: Where then is my hope? And as for my hope, who shall see it?
hmr: Ka beiseina chu khâwlai am ni tâng a ta? Ka beiseina chu tuin am hmu tâng a ta?

en: It shall go down to the bars of Sheol, When once there is rest in the dust.
hmr: Seol kawt bulahai chun fe thlâng a ta, Pilvutah châwl hmunkhat tâng kan tih,” tiin.
